pr_title: Support mathematical functions ceil/ceiling, exp, floor, ln, log

timeline.message: Support ceil/ceiling, exact, exp, floor, ln, log functions

timeline.bodyText: np: can all these methods reuse a method like FunctionExpression  compile(BuiltinFunctionName name, Expression...exprs)
timeline.author: dai-chen

timeline.bodyText: What's the difference between this new method and binaryOperator() above?
timeline.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: only the toString method is different, for example operator add with args a and b is to a + b, and function log with the args is to log(a, b)
replies.author: chloe-zh

replies.bodyText: Okay. For now toString seems being used for column name in response, I think we can treat arithmetic and function toString same way later when column name is retrieved in other way.
replies.author: dai-chen

timeline.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: Yes the same function but with different registered name
replies.author: chloe-zh

replies.bodyText: I see. I think we can refactor these kind of similar function family later by generating from same method with different argument, such as substr and substring, log and log2 etc.
replies.author: dai-chen

timeline.bodyText: For assertion on floating-point number, please check if we're using matcher like isCloseTo() to avoid precision problem.
timeline.author: dai-chen
